result.reason: Ben.Demystifier would improve stack trace readability in error logging across ~48 files, useful for support diagnostics but low priority nice-to-have.
result.approach: Add Ben.Demystifier NuGet package and call .Demystify() on exceptions in the central error handling paths (ProgramRoot unhandled exception handler, FrmUnhandledException, MessageCollector) rather than modifying all 48 files — the package works by extension method on Exception objects at the point of display/logging.

attempts.raw_output:
Now I have enough context to triage this. The issue is a feature request from 2019 to integrate [Ben.Demystifier](https://github.com/benaadams/Ben.Demystifier) NuGet package to make stack traces in error logging more readable. There are ~48 files that reference StackTrace/Exception.ToString patterns. It's a nice-to-have enhancement but low priority — it only improves developer/support debugging readability, doesn't fix any bug or security issue.
